title: Determining if there is a Vertical Asymptote
text: To determine if there is a vertical asymptote, we need to look for values of $$x$$ which would make the function undefined. In this case, if we plugged in $$x=2$$ or $$x=-2$$, then the function would become $$\frac{8}{0}$$ or $$\frac{-8}{0}$$ which are undefined.

title: Determining if there is a Horizontal Asymptote
text: To determine if there is a horizontal asymptote, we need to find the limit of the function as $$x$$ approaches infinity and negative $$\infty$$. If we get a real number, then there is a horizontal asymptote there. If not, then there is no horizontal asymptote for the function.
